titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the New York University Archives Collection of School of Engineering Technical Reports MC.326
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-14 08:44:51 -0500.

did.unittitle: New York University Archives Collection of School of Engineering Technical Reports
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
did.abstract: The New York University Tandon School of Engineering was founded in 1854 as Brooklyn Collegiate and Polytechnic Institute. In 2014, the programs merged with New York University to become the second oldest private engineering and technology school in the United States. This collection consists of technical reports produced by the New York University School of Engineering from 1959-1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of technical reports produced by the New York University School of Engineering from 1959-1979.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from repository. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by Carol Hutchins in May 2019; the accession number associated with this gift is 2019.054.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Items were weeded from collections at other academic institutions and transferred to New York University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; New York University Archives Collection of School of Engineering Technical Reports; MC 326; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, and described on the collection-level.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The New York University Tandon School of Engineering was founded in 1854 as Brooklyn Collegiate and Polytechnic Institute. In 2014, the programs merged with New York University to become the second oldest private engineering and technology school in the United States.
